p:
G. obscuriglobus cells were grown for 4 days at 28 °C in PYGV liquid medium with 100 μg mL −1 of terbinafine or without. 1 mL of each culture was pelleted, washed once in phosphate-buffered saline, and resuspended in sterile ddH 2O. This suspension was spotted onto a 1% agarose-PYGV pad on a glass slide. The pad contained 100 μg mL −1 terbinafine for the treated cells. The pad was covered with a glass coverslip and sealed with a mixture of equal amount of petroleum jelly, lanolin, and paraffin wax (VALAP), leaving enough empty space around the agarose pad to provide the cells with sufficient oxygen. A single field of cells was imaged every 30 min during 14 h on a Zeiss Axio Imager Z2 epifluorescence microscope equipped with a Hamamatsu Orca-Flash4.0 sCMOS camera and a Plan-Apochromat 100×/1.46 Oil Ph3 objective. The images were collected in the Zen Blue software and processed using ImageJ and the EBImage package in Program R
26 .
